A webvr a-frame scene with blue sky and a plane where I can move around
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Below is an example of a simple A-Frame scene that includes a blue sky and a plane you can move around. Everything is contained within a single HTML file, with embedded CSS and JavaScript. You can save this code to an `.html` file and open it in a compatible browser to experience the WebVR scene.

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>WebVR A-Frame Scene</title>
    <script src="https://aframe.io/releases/1.2.0/aframe.min.js"></script>
    <style>
        body {
            margin: 0;
            overflow: hidden;
        }
        a-scene {
            display: block;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <a-scene>
        <!-- Sky -->
        <a-sky color="skyblue"></a-sky>
        
        <!-- Ground Plane -->
        <a-plane 
            position="0 0 -5" 
            rotation="-90 0 0" 
            width="10" 
            height="10" 
            color="#7CFC00" 
            shadow></a-plane>

        <!-- Camera -->
        <a-entity camera look-controls position="0 1.6 0"></a-entity>

        <!-- Light -->
        <a-light type="ambient" color="#FFFFFF"></a-light>
        <a-light type="directional" position="-1 1 1" intensity="0.5"></a-light>
    </a-scene>

    <script>
        // Any additional JavaScript code can be added here
    </script>
</body>
</html>
```

### Instructions to Use:
1. Copy the code above and paste it into a text editor.
2. Save the file with a `.html` extension (e.g., `webvr-scene.html`).
3. Open the saved file in a modern browser that supports WebVR or WebXR, such as Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox.
4. You should see a blue sky and a green ground plane, and you can move around using your keyboard or VR headset.

### Movement Controls:
- If you're using a mouse or keyboard, you can use the arrow keys or WASD keys to move around in the scene.
- In a VR headset, it will allow you to walk around using your controller. 

Enjoy your WebVR experience!
